title: Site Information
text:
The current build is from 29 November 2025.
The website was created by me using Quarto pages. It is hosted with Netlify, and the source code can be found on the public GitHub repo here.
The site typeface is Atkinson Hyperlegible Next (and Atkinson Hyperlegible Mono), an accessibility-focused design created by the Braile Institute (more information here).
Significant thanks to Jose Toledo Luna‚Äôs instructions, which provided much needed instruction.

title: Sports Sabermetric Predictive Comparison Report*
text:
*IN PROGRESS
Download the Report here (.pdf)
(get source file here) (.tex)




This project focused on comparing the predictive abilities of different classes of sabermetric statistics in sports. Using 2025 WNBA data, I developed classification models with the goal of predicting a win/loss outcomes.
Sport fans will be familiar with the divide between classic, ‚Äúold-school‚Äù statistical categories and new, ‚Äúsabermetric‚Äù metrics designed to be a more advanced indicator of performance. Often, one set of these statistics will be favored over others, by both casual fans and award voters alike.
This project seeks to determine whether advanced or basic team statistical categories in sports is more predictive of team success at the team level. The resulting report will show the modeling strategies, test outputs, and corresponding conclusions.







Graphical results (to be updated later):

title: Mason Kellerman
text:
I currently attend the University of California, Los Angeles, and will be graduating this spring with Psychology, B.A. and Statistics & Data Science, B.S. degrees, with a minor in Educational Studies.
I am interested in on designing effective measures/assessments which enable effective and consistent causal conclusions about underlying features. I care about making a positive impact on individuals with my work through affecting institutional progress. More information about me can be found in my resume.
I am interested in opportunities that further this vision; I appreciate all outreach :)
